title: Modern physics - work function photon momentum

content.question: Which expression is equal to the work function of the metal surface?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator h, and denominator 2 p sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>h</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>p</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 p sub 0, end sub, c, and denominator h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>p</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>c</mi></mrow><mi>h</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator h f, and denominator 2 p sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>h</mi><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>p</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="2 p sub 0, end sub, c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>p</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>c</mi></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 p sub 0, end sub, c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>p</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>c</mi></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
